arm_group.description: Participants will log into a personalized website and engage in computerized tasks online.
Participants will log into a personalized website and engage in computerized tasks online.

brief_summary.textblock:
The present study will explore the effectiveness of a computer based neurobehavioral
      intervention in improving cognition and emotion regulation in a college freshmen population.
      It will increase understanding of emotion-regulation and cognition at a neural-circuit level
      and aid development of new interventions for emotion regulatory problems.

clinical_study.brief_title: Computerized Interventions for College Students' Cognitive Functioning and Mental Well-being

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  internet access

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  lifetime psychotic disorder,

          -  past-year substance dependence

intervention.description: Targeted, computerized interventions completed from the participants' own home on a computer.

facility.name: Stanford University, Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences

clinical_study.official_title: Computerized Interventions for College Students' Cognitive Functioning and Mental Well-being

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cognition - executive function behavioral reaction time

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Basic Science
